author: lzybkr
body:
copied from MSFT:7266395

ISSUE: PropertyNotFoundException does not set the TargetObject property to the object for which the property could not be found.

IMPACT:
Debugging these exceptions is unnecessarily difficult because information about the object missing the property (such as its type or members) can't be logged via the exception record.

EXAMPLE:
When developing a test platform, a property that's expected to be on an XML node is missing.  The debug output produced by our platform is below.  I want to enhance this output to tell me the type and members of the object whose property access produced the exception, which would greatly reduce debug time.
